meanings.definition: Distinguish between two or more things.
meanings.sent1: She easily differentiates between the colors red and blue.
meanings.sent2: The detective differentiates the real painting from the fake one.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to differentiate between identical twins.
meanings.sent4: His keen sense of smell differentiates him from the other bloodhounds.
meanings.sent5: The unique pattern on each butterfly's wings differentiates them from one another.

meanings.definition: Make someone or something appear different or distinct.
meanings.sent1: The new hairstyle really differentiates her from her twin sister.
meanings.sent2: The lighting in the room differentiates the various shades of blue.
meanings.sent3: The artist's brush strokes magically differentiate the plain canvas.
meanings.sent4: The bold font choice differentiates the title from the rest of the text.
meanings.sent5: The special effects in the movie differentiate the aliens from the humans.

meanings.sent1: Each seed differentiates into a unique type of flower.
meanings.sent2: The cells in the body differentiate to form different tissues.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret recipe differentiates his dish from all others.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar will soon differentiate into a beautiful butterfly.
meanings.sent5: The student's interests will differentiate as they grow older.
